cyclone.name: CLAUDETTE
cyclone.current_location: about 310 miles south of Morgan City, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north toward the central Louisiana coast, then expected to turn northeast across Mississippi and Alabama
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Louisiana coast near Morgan City–Grand Isle area (just southwest of New Orleans)

weather_observation.warning_coast: Intracoastal City, LA eastward to the Okaloosa/Walton County line, FL, including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, and Metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeast Texas/Louisiana eastward to the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph with higher gusts) likely around landfall and for several hours afterward
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 2–3 ft possible in Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas and low-lying coastal areas around metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches with isolated 12-inch totals possible, creating flash, urban, and small-stream flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes beginning Friday afternoon and continuing into Saturday
